mcai.errors.nonexistent_character_id: That character ID does not exist!
mcai.errors.no_suitable_ai_found: No suitable AI with the name of '%s' was found. Are they disabled?
mcai.errors.no_history: You don't have chat history with %s.
mcai.errors.no_authorization_token: You need to set an authorization token to chat!
mcai.messages.character_register_success: Successfully registered %s. You can send them a message by including @%s in your chat message!
mcai.messages.character_unregister_succe: %s has been unregistered. Pinging them in chat will no longer send them a message; you'll have to re-register the character to talk to them again.
mcai.messages.enabled_ai: Enabled %s. They will now respond to pings again.
mcai.messages.disabled_ai: %s will no longer respond to any future pings until re-enabled.
config.mcai.title: Minecraft AI Config
config.mcai.general.format.description: Message format determines your messages will be formatted for the AI. {name} is replaced with your username, and {message} is replaced with the text you sent.
config.mcai.general.replyFormat.descript: Reply format determines how AI messages will be formatted when sent into the Minecraft chat. This option is mainly here for those who have a Minecraft mod that changes how the chat is formatted, so that the AI messages can fit in.
config.mcai.general.authorization.descri: This is the authorization token of your https://c.ai account. Obtain it by going to https://c.ai -> Inspect Element -> Application -> Local Storage -> char_token -> value.
config.mcai.general.adminPermissionLevel: The restricted command level is the minimum required level for running restricted commands. Currently, only /ai register and /ai unregister are restricted commands.
config.mcai.ais.name: Name
config.mcai.ais.name.description: This is the name that Reply Format will use when formatting AI responses.
config.mcai.ais.id.description: This is the character ID. You can obtain a character's ID from https://c.ai by opening a chat with a character and then selecting the text after 'char='.
config.mcai.ais.historyId.description: The history ID is the ID of your current chat. Running /ai new chat will generate a new history ID, and thus resets the conversation.
config.mcai.ais.aliases.description: Aliases are alternative names you can ping the AI in chat with. For example, when aliases contains 'hello', you can type '@hello' in chat to talk with the AI, instead of its name.
